title: Claude Code Instructions
text: NEVER use Urban Institute API, NCES CCD, federal data source — entire point packages provide STATE-LEVEL data directly state . Federal sources aggregate/transform data differently lose state-specific details. state DOE source broken, FIX find alternative STATE source — fall back federal data.

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: NEVER reference Claude, Claude Code, AI assistance commit messages NEVER reference Claude, Claude Code, AI assistance PR descriptions NEVER add Co-Authored-lines mentioning Claude Anthropic Keep commit messages focused changed, written

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: package includes tests/testthat/test-pipeline-live.R LIVE network tests.

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: URL Availability - HTTP 200 checks File Download - Verify actual file (HTML error) File Parsing - readxl/readr succeeds Column Structure - Expected columns exist get_raw_enr() - Raw data function works Data Quality - Inf/NaN, non-negative counts Aggregation - State total > 0 Output Fidelity - tidy=TRUE matches raw

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: See state-schooldata/CLAUDE.md complete testing framework documentation.

title: msschooldata: Mississippi School Enrollment Data
text: Documentation | Getting Started Fetch analyze Mississippi school enrollment data Mississippi Department Education (MDE) R Python.

what: What can you find with msschooldata?
title: msschooldata: Mississippi School Enrollment Data
text: 18 years enrollment data (2007-2024). 440,000 students. 144 districts. ten stories hiding numbers:

previous_headings: What can you find with msschooldata?
what: 1. Mississippi is majority Black in many districts
title: msschooldata: Mississippi School Enrollment Data
text: Unlike Southern states, Mississippi numerous majority-Black school districts, especially Delta region.
code: library(msschooldata) library(dplyr)  enr_2024 <- fetch_enr(2024)  enr_2024 %>%   filter(is_district, subgroup == "black", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   arrange(desc(pct)) %>%   mutate(pct = round(pct * 100, 1)) %>%   select(district_name, n_students, pct) %>%   head(10)

previous_headings: What can you find with msschooldata?
title: msschooldata: Mississippi School Enrollment Data
text: Districts Mississippi Delta (Coahoma, Bolivar, Sunflower, Leflore) lost 30-50% students since 2007.
code: enr <- fetch_enr_multi(c(2007, 2012, 2017, 2022, 2024))  delta <- c("Coahoma County", "Bolivar County", "Sunflower County", "Leflore County")  enr %>%   filter(is_district, grepl(paste(delta, collapse = "|"), district_name, ignore.case = TRUE),          subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   select(end_year, district_name, n_students)

previous_headings: What can you find with msschooldata?
title: msschooldata: Mississippi School Enrollment Data
text: Bordering Memphis, DeSoto County nearly doubled enrollment become state’s second-largest district.
code: enr %>%   filter(is_district, grepl("DeSoto", district_name),          subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   select(end_year, n_students)

previous_headings: What can you find with msschooldata?
title: msschooldata: Mississippi School Enrollment Data
text: Mississippi’s capital city lost 40% students, 32,000 20,000.
code: enr %>%   filter(is_district, grepl("Jackson Public", district_name),          subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   select(end_year, n_students)

previous_headings: What can you find with msschooldata?
title: msschooldata: Mississippi School Enrollment Data
text: 75% Mississippi students economically disadvantaged - highest rate nation.
code: enr <- fetch_enr_multi(2015:2024)  enr %>%   filter(is_state, subgroup == "econ_disadv", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   mutate(pct = round(pct * 100, 1)) %>%   select(end_year, n_students, pct)

previous_headings: What can you find with msschooldata?
title: msschooldata: Mississippi School Enrollment Data
text: Mississippi lost 7% kindergartners 2021 enrollment hasn’t recovered.
code: enr %>%   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment",          grade_level %in% c("K", "01", "06", "12")) %>%   select(end_year, grade_level, n_students)

previous_headings: What can you find with msschooldata?
title: msschooldata: Mississippi School Enrollment Data
text: Madison County (north Jackson) grown Jackson shrinks - classic suburban flight.
code: enr %>%   filter(is_district, grepl("Madison County", district_name),          subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   select(end_year, n_students)

previous_headings: What can you find with msschooldata?
title: msschooldata: Mississippi School Enrollment Data
text: 2% 4% statewide, districts like Forest Municipal reaching 20%+.
code: enr_2024 %>%   filter(is_district, subgroup == "hispanic", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   arrange(desc(pct)) %>%   mutate(pct = round(pct * 100, 1)) %>%   select(district_name, n_students, pct) %>%   head(10)

previous_headings: What can you find with msschooldata?
title: msschooldata: Mississippi School Enrollment Data
text: Gulf Coast districts (Harrison, Jackson County, Hancock) maintained enrollment despite hurricanes.
code: coast <- c("Harrison County", "Jackson County", "Hancock County")  enr %>%   filter(is_district, grepl(paste(coast, collapse = "|"), district_name),          subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   select(end_year, district_name, n_students)

previous_headings: What can you find with msschooldata?
title: msschooldata: Mississippi School Enrollment Data
text: Mississippi one smallest charter sectors - 5,000 students entire state.
code: enr_2024 %>%   filter(is_charter, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   summarize(     total_charter = sum(n_students, na.rm = TRUE),     n_schools = n()   )

title: msschooldata: Mississippi School Enrollment Data
code: library(msschooldata) library(dplyr)  # Fetch one year enr_2024 <- fetch_enr(2024)  # Fetch multiple years enr_multi <- fetch_enr_multi(2020:2024)  # State totals enr_2024 %>%   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL")  # Largest districts enr_2024 %>%   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   arrange(desc(n_students)) %>%   head(15)  # Jackson demographics enr_2024 %>%   filter(grepl("Jackson Public", district_name), grade_level == "TOTAL",          subgroup %in% c("white", "black", "hispanic", "asian")) %>%   select(subgroup, n_students, pct)

title: msschooldata: Mississippi School Enrollment Data
code: import pymsschooldata as ms  # Check available years years = ms.get_available_years() print(f"Data available from {years['min_year']} to {years['max_year']}")  # Fetch one year enr_2024 = ms.fetch_enr(2024)  # Fetch multiple years enr_multi = ms.fetch_enr_multi([2020, 2021, 2022, 2023, 2024])  # State totals state_total = enr_2024[     (enr_2024['is_state'] == True) &     (enr_2024['subgroup'] == 'total_enrollment') &     (enr_2024['grade_level'] == 'TOTAL') ]  # Largest districts districts = enr_2024[     (enr_2024['is_district'] == True) &     (enr_2024['subgroup'] == 'total_enrollment') &     (enr_2024['grade_level'] == 'TOTAL') ].sort_values('n_students', ascending=False).head(15)  # Jackson demographics jackson = enr_2024[     (enr_2024['district_name'].str.contains('Jackson Public', na=False)) &     (enr_2024['grade_level'] == 'TOTAL') &     (enr_2024['subgroup'].isin(['white', 'black', 'hispanic', 'asian'])) ][['subgroup', 'n_students', 'pct']]

title: msschooldata: Mississippi School Enrollment Data
text: Data sourced Mississippi Department Education: - Primary Portal: https://newreports.mdek12.org/ - Data Explorer: https://newreports.mdek12.org/DataExplorer - Data Download: https://newreports.mdek12.org/DataDownload

title: msschooldata: Mississippi School Enrollment Data
text: Levels: State, District (144), School Demographics: White, Black, Hispanic, Asian, Native American, Pacific Islander, Multiracial Gender: Male, Female Special populations: Economically disadvantaged, English learners, Special education Grade levels: PK 12

title: msschooldata: Mississippi School Enrollment Data
text: Mississippi approximately 144 school districts 1,000+ public schools Total enrollment approximately 440,000 students District IDs: Typically 4-digit codes School IDs: District code plus additional digits Data collection: Mississippi Student Information System (MSIS), October 1 counts Charter sector: small law - limited authorization Data suppression: Small cell sizes may suppressed privacy

Fetch Mississippi enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: Downloads processes enrollment data Mississippi Department Education data portal newreports.mdek12.org.

title: Fetch Mississippi enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: end_year school year. Year end academic year - eg 2023-24 school year year '2024'. Valid values 2007-2024 (data available 2006-07 school year onwards). tidy TRUE (default), returns data long (tidy) format subgroup column. FALSE, returns wide format. use_cache TRUE (default), uses locally cached data available. Set FALSE force re-download MDE.

title: Fetch Mississippi enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: Data frame enrollment data. Wide format includes columns district_id, school_id, names, enrollment counts demographic/grade. Tidy format pivots counts subgroup grade_level columns.

title: Fetch Mississippi enrollment data — fetch_enr
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get 2024 enrollment data (2023-24 school year) enr_2024 <- fetch_enr(2024)  # Get wide format enr_wide <- fetch_enr(2024, tidy = FALSE)  # Force fresh download (ignore cache) enr_fresh <- fetch_enr(2024, use_cache = FALSE)  # Filter to specific district jackson <- enr_2024 %>%   dplyr::filter(district_name == "JACKSON PUBLIC SCHOOL DIST") } # }

text: end_years Vector school year ends (e.g., c(2022, 2023, 2024)) tidy TRUE (default), returns data long (tidy) format. use_cache TRUE (default), uses locally cached data available.

title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi

title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get 3 years of data enr_multi <- fetch_enr_multi(2022:2024)  # Track enrollment trends enr_multi %>%   dplyr::filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   dplyr::select(end_year, n_students) } # }

what: msschooldata: Fetch and Process Mississippi School Data — msschooldata-package
title: msschooldata: Fetch and Process Mississippi School Data — msschooldata-package
text: Downloads processes school data Mississippi Department Education (MDE). Provides functions fetching enrollment data MDE reporting system transforming tidy format analysis. Data sourced Mississippi Student Information System (MSIS) includes enrollment counts grade, race/ethnicity, gender, special populations 2006 present. msschooldata package provides functions downloading, processing, analyzing school enrollment data Mississippi Department Education (MDE). Data sourced MDE reporting system newreports.mdek12.org.

title: msschooldata: Fetch and Process Mississippi School Data — msschooldata-package
text: Mississippi Department Education (MDE) provides enrollment data public reporting portal. Data collected via Mississippi Student Information System (MSIS) reflects enrollment counts October 1 school year.

title: msschooldata: Fetch and Process Mississippi School Data — msschooldata-package
text: Years: 2007 present (2006-07 school year onwards) Aggregation levels: State, District, School Demographics: Race/ethnicity (7 categories), gender Special populations: Economically disadvantaged, LEP, Special Education Grade levels: PK 12

title: msschooldata: Fetch and Process Mississippi School Data — msschooldata-package
text: fetch_enr Download enrollment data single year fetch_enr_multi Download enrollment data multiple years tidy_enr Transform wide format long/tidy format get_available_years List available data years

title: msschooldata: Fetch and Process Mississippi School Data — msschooldata-package
text: Downloaded data cached locally avoid repeated downloads. Use cache_status see cached files clear_cache remove .
